structure.unit: Real And Personal Property And Domestic Relations
Descent And Distribution, Wills, Estates Of Deceased Persons And Absentees, Guardianship, Conservatorship And Trusts

law.catch_line: Revocation Of Letters Of Administration By Proof Of Will
law.text: [ Text of section effective until March 31, 2012. Repealed by 2008, 521, Sec. 13. See 2008, 521, Sec. 44 as amended by 2010, 409, Sec. 23 and 2011, 224.] If, after the granting of letters of administration as upon an intestate estate, a will of the person deceased is duly proved and allowed, such letters shall be revoked; and the executor or an administrator with the will annexed may demand, collect and sue for all the personal property of the deceased which remains unadministered.
